result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent Elliot Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1) The defendant shall pay at a minimum rate of $100 per month on a payment plan.  His first payment is due in October, 2022.
2) All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has thirty (30) days to make payment of any amount ordered unless other arrangements are made with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    
Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees). 
3) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.

Defendant is not eligible for good time.
Consecutive to: Burnett County case 19CF24

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent Elliot Reynolds

records.addlTxt:
3:49 PM Defendant Brent Elliot Reynolds in court, in custody.  Attorney David L. Christian appeared by video for Brent Elliot Reynolds.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case set for prelim, but paperwork indicates case has reached a misdemeanor resolution. Case proceeds to a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court reviews paperwork- agreement is to amend to misdemeanor obstruct an officer with joint rec for 30 days concurrent jail.  State moves to amend as stated; Court grants.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 1 and orders a JOC.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, notes no jail credit.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  Discussion of payment plan.
Court orders: 
5 days jail, consecutive to 19CF24 (no good time, no jail credit).
$200 DNA surcharge- to be entered into a payment plan $100/month, starting in October, 2022.
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

Initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:17 PM Defendant Brent Elliot Reynolds in court, in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brent Elliot Reynolds appeared by video means.  Case was on for initial appearance.  Atty Pollak appears, cannot represent, Court to adjourn the initial appearance.  Def in custody until September on another matter, not objecting to adjourning while PD looks for counsel.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
